page.title: 11STISTED,A PERSONAL VIEW
page.content: {*}The interviewee was a 74-year-old widow who has lived in Stisted all her life.She has featured in an Anglia T.V.programme about the village and intends to write a local history.She identified three areas of deficiency: public transport,medical services and sheltered housing for the elderly. Apart from the bus service to Braintree on Wednesday and Saturday there was no service to the village. The Colchester/Braintree service by the A120 was the nearest regular route but the walk to the main road was too much for the elderly.A community bus was a hoped-for solution. {*}No medical services were provided even on a part-time basis.A sheltered housing scheme was needed by the elderly who could not cope in their own homes,but who wanted to stay in the village.
